head.title: Festival of Music To Skate By

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New Jersey
Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Music, Theater and Dance

hedline.hl1: Festival of Music To Skate By

abstract.p: Photo essay of activities during Warped Tour 2000 stop at Asbury Park, NJ

block.p: IT was a mix of music and motion that came to a lot near the boardwalk in Asbury Park last weekend as the Warped Tour 2000 made its second of two stops in the state. It had played earlier in the week in Camden. This is the sixth year for the traveling punk rock festival, which makes 40 stops across the country and in Canada in a six-week run. The tour ends on Aug. 6 in Texas.

Billie Joe Armstrong of Green Day, top left, and Jason Navarro, far right, of the Suicide Machines were intwo of the 40 bands in the tour playing the four stages set up for music. Local bands were invited to perform in a battle of the bands competition as well.

IT was a mix of music and motion that came to a lot near the boardwalk in Asbury Park last weekend as the Warped Tour 2000 made its second of two stops in the state. It had played earlier in the week in Camden. This is the sixth year for the traveling punk rock festival, which makes 40 stops across the country and in Canada in a six-week run. The tour ends on Aug. 6 in Texas.

Billie Joe Armstrong of Green Day, top left, and Jason Navarro, far right, of the Suicide Machines were intwo of the 40 bands in the tour playing the four stages set up for music. Local bands were invited to perform in a battle of the bands competition as well.

While the music played, Brian Wainwright, top right, took to the air in a roller skating match on a ramp that had been set up for competition and demonstrations in roller skating, in-line skating, skateboarding and BMX bicycles. Motor-cross racing went on nearby.
More than 12,000 people paid $24.95 each to attend the festival, which started at noon and went on until after sundown.
